page.title: 16Housing Survey
page.content:
The majority of houses were built before 1930, many dating back to the beginning of the century. The most recent are two bungalows which were built in 1979. Most are large terraced houses, many of which have been turned into flats or used as Bed and Breakfast accommodation.
There were twelve terraced streets in Warrenby but these were demolished in the 1970's because of their poor condition.
There are very few gardens in the area because of the terracing although all the houses have backyards. The more recent houses, mainly small semi-detached, have small gardens back and front. Not many houses have front garages. Most are behind the houses with access via back alleys.
